definitions.definition: to partly close your eyes in order to see more clearly:
examples: The sun was shining straight in her eyes and made her squint.

definitions.definition: If a person or an eye squints, the eye looks in a different direction to the other eye, because of a weakness of the eye muscles:
examples: Lili's left eye squinted slightly when she was tired.

definitions.definition: a condition caused by a weakness of the eye muscles that makes the eyes look in different directions from each other:
examples: As a child she wore thick glasses and had a bad squint.
